channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Syria, once home to a large Jewish community, takes steps to return property to Jews
item.description: A Jewish heritage foundation has set out to help restore private property appropriated after Syrian Jews left the country.
item.content:encoded:
A Jewish heritage foundation has set out to help restore private property appropriated after Syrian Jews left the country.

(Image credit: Jane Arraf)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: The U.K. investigates its ex-ambassador to the U.S. over alleged leaks to Epstein
item.description: The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market-sensitive information with Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market-sensitive information with Epstein.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Paris prosecutors raid X offices as part of investigation into child abuse images
item.description: The prosecutors raided the offices of X as part of a preliminary investigation into allegations including spreading child sexual abuse images and deepfakes. They also summoned owner Elon Musk for questioning.
item.content:encoded:
The prosecutors raided the offices of X as part of a preliminary investigation into allegations including spreading child sexual abuse images and deepfakes. They also summoned owner Elon Musk for questioning.

(Image credit: Rick Rycroft)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Takeaways from the latest Epstein files. And, police search for Savannah Guthrie's mom
item.description: NPR analyzes the latest Jeffrey Epstein files. And, Arizona authorities launched an urgent search for Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother, Nancyafter a suspected home abduction.
item.content:encoded:
NPR analyzes the latest Jeffrey Epstein files. And, Arizona authorities launched an urgent search for Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother, Nancyafter a suspected home abduction.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump says he will lower tariffs on India to 18%
item.description: President Trump says that he has agreed to a trade deal with India --- which will lower tariffs on the country to 18%.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says that he has agreed to a trade deal with India --- which will lower tariffs on the country to 18%.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Iranians seeking to punish ruling elite go after the next best thing -- their kids
item.description: Iranians in the diaspora are tracking down the sons and daughters of Iran's ruling elite, many of whom work and live lavishly abroad, demanding they be deported.
item.content:encoded: Iranians in the diaspora are tracking down the sons and daughters of Iran's ruling elite, many of whom work and live lavishly abroad, demanding they be deported.
item.dc:creator: Arezou Rezvani

item.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing reopens, but few have been allowed to cross
item.description: Gaza's main border crossing reopened Monday after being closed for most of the war, but few people have been allowed to cross.
item.content:encoded: Gaza's main border crossing reopened Monday after being closed for most of the war, but few people have been allowed to cross.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: U.S. and Iran to meet for negotiations over Iran's nuclear program
item.description: The U.S. and Iran will meet later this week in Turkey to discuss Iran's nuclear program. The negotiations come after President Trump weighed military strikes on Iran.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. and Iran will meet later this week in Turkey to discuss Iran's nuclear program. The negotiations come after President Trump weighed military strikes on Iran.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: What to know to know ahead of the negotiations between U.S. and Iran
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks Suzanne Maloney, vice president and director of the foreign policy program at the Brookings Institution, about U.S. negotiations with Iran.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin asks Suzanne Maloney, vice president and director of the foreign policy program at the Brookings Institution, about U.S. negotiations with Iran.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Trevi Fountain fee takes effect as Rome seeks to manage tourist crowds
item.description: Tourists hoping to get close to the Trevi Fountain had to pay 2 euros starting Monday as the city of Rome inaugurated a new fee structure to help raise money and control crowds.
item.content:encoded:
Tourists hoping to get close to the Trevi Fountain had to pay 2 euros starting Monday as the city of Rome inaugurated a new fee structure to help raise money and control crowds.

(Image credit: Roberto Monaldo/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
